They were asking for it, let's walk!

May 12, 2011

 It all started at the Toronto university after a policeman stated that woman shouldn't dress like sluts in order to not be harassed. The 20 students who were present were too stunned to confront the officer at that moment. Soon this grew up to a movement fighting for the right of people to dress like sluts without beeing sexually harassed. 

 The first time I encountered this movement was on facebook when one of my friends shared a poster of the first slutwalk in Amsterdam. It wouldn't be the first one because there have already been sluts walking around New York, San Diego, Reno and there will be one in Teheran etc. Since I am a male person and often characterized as 'slightly macho' the word 'slut' immediatly attracted my attention. So I tried to find out more about this phenomenon.

 It appeared that woman wish to be able to dress however they want without beeing sexually harassed. So, beeing a macho male primate, I was thinking: fair, but what's in it for me?

 The answer is: the ability to check out sluts! A dirty mind is a joy forever, Oscar Wilde once said and I can't say I disagree. The only thing necesairy to sustainable enjoy sluts is to make them feel comfortable by not harassing them. Easy as pie and it sounds like a win-win situation to me. And besides, since when is beeing a slut something only reserved for woman?

 So, no matter if you are male or female find the nearest walk, get out and support your sluts so everybody can sustainable enjoy people that like to show some skin!

Publication made by the Mašta collective.

Inspired by the activities and experiences of the network, the Mašta collective has created the "Microevolutions - a practical guide to creative activism"
